title: Discourse-Based Project Learning for Job Analysis in Educational Technology and Design Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational technology theories and science curriculum design experience
context.additional_context: Conducting projects that apply comparisons of instructional technology job characteristics to science curriculum design

learning_goals: They can collect and analyze over 20 job postings related to educational technology to derive at least five core competencies.
They can write a report comparing conceptual differences across educational design domains using discourse analysis techniques.
They can propose and present an educational technology job model applicable to science curriculum design using a PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
